item.title: Change My View On Reddit Helps People Challenge Their Own Opinions
item.description: June 29, 2017 - Four years ago, a Scottish teenager set out to do the impossible: cordon off a space for measured, civil conversation between people who believe different things — on the Internet! Now there are over 300,000 members of the Change My View subreddit. The founder talks about the surprising rules he had to implement in order to make the space work, and a researcher tells us who discovered a kind of agree-to-disagree inflection point by studying the group.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 29, 2017 - Four years ago, a Scottish teenager set out to do the impossible: cordon off a space for measured, civil conversation between people who believe different things — on the Internet! Now there are over 300,000 members of the Change My View subreddit. The founder talks about the surprising rules he had to implement in order to make the space work, and a researcher tells us who discovered a kind of agree-to-disagree inflection point by studying the group. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/29/534916052/change-my-view-on-reddit-helps-people-challenge-their-own-opinions

item.title: Shadow Brokers Group Leaks Stolen National Security Agency Hacking Tools
item.description: June 29, 2017 - Last August, hacking tools were stolen from the National Security Agency. Now, those tools are being used in a number of cyber attacks around the world, and there's mounting pressure on the NSA to do something. NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Nicole Perlroth, who has been covering this for The New York Times.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Sony Will Start Making Vinyl Records Again In Japan, After A Nearly 30-Year Hiatus
item.description: June 29, 2017 - Sony says it's meeting new demand from young people who buy records they've heard on streaming services. The company stopped pressing vinyl in 1989.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 29, 2017 - Sony says it's meeting new demand from young people who buy records they've heard on streaming services. The company stopped pressing vinyl in 1989. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/29/534854280/sony-will-start-making-vinyl-records-again-in-japan-after-nearly-30-year-hiatus

item.title: In China, A Cashless Trend Is Taking Hold With Mobile Payments
item.description: June 29, 2017 - Consumers there are finding convenience and security in using smartphones to pay. An estimated $5.5 trillion was spent through mobile platforms in 2016, about 50 times the amount in the U.S.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 29, 2017 - Consumers there are finding convenience and security in using smartphones to pay. An estimated $5.5 trillion was spent through mobile platforms in 2016, about 50 times the amount in the U.S. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/29/534846403/in-china-a-cashless-trend-is-taking-hold-with-mobile-payments

item.title: How Europe Is Grappling With Increased Cybersecurity Threats
item.description: June 29, 2017 - European cybersecurity experts have been meeting in Brussels to discuss ways to combat recent attacks, including Tuesday's malware infection of thousands of business computers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 29, 2017 - European cybersecurity experts have been meeting in Brussels to discuss ways to combat recent attacks, including Tuesday's malware infection of thousands of business computers. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/29/534835108/how-europe-is-grappling-with-increased-threats-to-cybersecurity

item.title: Trump Picks Republican Lawyer For FCC Commissioner Seat
item.description: June 29, 2017 - President Trump will name former telecom attorney and current FCC lawyer Brendan Carr to serve as a commissioner. He is expected to back Chairman Ajit Pai's efforts to undo net neutrality rules.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 29, 2017 - President Trump will name former telecom attorney and current FCC lawyer Brendan Carr to serve as a commissioner. He is expected to back Chairman Ajit Pai's efforts to undo net neutrality rules. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/29/534828696/trump-picks-republican-lawyer-for-fcc-commissioner-seat

item.title: 'Petya' Ransomware Hits At Least 65 Countries; Microsoft Traces It To Tax Software
item.description: June 28, 2017 - An updated version of the malware has the ability to worm through computer networks, gathering passwords and credentials and spreading itself.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - An updated version of the malware has the ability to worm through computer networks, gathering passwords and credentials and spreading itself. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/28/534679950/petya-ransomware-hits-at-least-65-countries-microsoft-traces-it-to-tax-software

item.title: New Ransomware Attack Spreads From Ukraine
item.description: June 28, 2017 - A cyberattack spread from Ukraine to Europe and around the world Tuesday. Cybersecurity expert Matt Tait of Capital Alpha Security tells Rachel Martin about who is vulnerable.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - A cyberattack spread from Ukraine to Europe and around the world Tuesday. Cybersecurity expert Matt Tait of Capital Alpha Security tells Rachel Martin about who is vulnerable. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/28/534671413/new-ransomware-attack-spreads-from-ukraine

item.title: European Union Fines Google $2.7 Billion
item.description:
June 28, 2017 - The European Union has fined Google $2.7 billion over what it calls anti-competitive practices. Steve Inskeep talks with Adrianne Jeffries of The Outline.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/28/534671469/european-union-fines-google-2-7-billion
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Morning News Brief: Health Care Vote Delayed, New Ransomware Attack Spreads
item.description: June 28, 2017 - We look at the future of the Senate's health care bill after Republican leaders postponed a vote. Also, a new ransomware attack has spread from Ukraine, and we update the fight against Boko Haram.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - We look at the future of the Senate's health care bill after Republican leaders postponed a vote. item.title: Cyber Attacks Spread Across Europe Using Stolen NSA Tool
item.description: June 27, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel speaks with Dmitri Alperovitch, co-founder and chief technology officer of CrowdStrike, on the cyber attacks spreading across Europe using a stolen National Security Agency tool.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Massive Ransomware Attack Hits Ukraine; Experts Say It's Spreading Globally
item.description: June 27, 2017 - Some have called the previously seen malware "Petya," though others say it is "a new ransomware that has not been seen before." It has been reported in at least a half-dozen countries.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Some have called the previously seen malware "Petya," though others say it is "a new ransomware that has not been seen before." It has been reported in at least a half-dozen countries. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/27/534560169/large-cyberattack-hits-ukraine-snarling-electric-grids-and-airports

item.title: Driving The Future: How Smart Can A Smart Car Be?
item.description: June 27, 2017 - Car owners form special relationships with their vehicles — they give them names, customize them and get to know their intricacies and quirks. But what if the car could do the same for the driver?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Car owners form special relationships with their vehicles — they give them names, customize them and get to know their intricacies and quirks. But what if the car could do the same for the driver? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-27/technology-and-the-auto-industry

item.title: Beyond The Valley Of The CEOs — Bringing Big Tech To Small Towns
item.description:
June 27, 2017 - Venture capital is concentrated on the coasts — how can investors be encouraged to spread the wealth?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-27/technology-and-the-economy
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Venture capital is concentrated on the coasts — how can investors be encouraged to spread the wealth? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-27/technology-and-the-economy

item.title: Google Fined Record $2.7 Billion In EU Anti-Trust Ruling
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The European Union says Google unfairly abused its power over search results to promote its own over competitors. It's the biggest fine the EU has ever given a single company in an anti-trust case.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The European Union says Google unfairly abused its power over search results to promote its own over competitors. It's the biggest fine the EU has ever given a single company in an anti-trust case. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534537556/google-fined-record-2-7-billion-in-eu-anti-trust-ruling
